results.title: The Human nervous system
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Robert Churchill and John McDonald
results.brief_description: Shows the differences and similarities between simple animals and humans to explain the role of the nervous system. Also studies the structure of the brain and its complexity. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Human machine
results.creator_credit: Moody Institute of Science. Educational Film Division

results.title: The Human machine
results.brief_description: Looks at the problems which confront people with physical disabilities and the ways modern technology can help them. Shows research and production of artificial limbs, the manner in which people with limited movements can become mobile and learn to communicate. Presented by James Dibble. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Human journey: the job
results.creator_credit: CTV Television Network and Jerry Lewton
results.brief_description: Examines the possible restructuring of jobs to suit individuals and human nature, to provide responsibility and challenge, and to ease the frustrations currently felt by so many workers.

results.title: The Human journey: the family
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated, CTV News and Bob Conroy
results.brief_description: Examines the evolution of the family as a social unit and discusses the problems resulting from modern families becoming increasingly smaller and more isolated. Suggests communal living, restructured neighbourhoods, and extended families as methods for making family life emotionally more comfortable.

results.title: The Human Jigsaw (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This documentary, that tells of one of Australia’s most successful efforts to fight drug addiction, is a “no holds barred” view on Odyssey House in Sydney and its drug rehabilitation program told by the residents undergoing treatment. It shows the progressive degradation of people through drug addiction to the depths of despair and hopelessness and the way in which the Odyssey program rebuilds shattered lives. The story addresses the cynicism of many people to the problems and reasons of addiction and cure.

results.title: The Human image: masculinity/femininity
results.creator_credit: CBS, Diantha Fielding and Kent Smith
results.brief_description: Contemporary account of changes to gender roles and social identity. The marriage of a young couple and their subsequent struggle to make their relationship work provides continuity in a montage of dramatised and animated scenes showing the feelings, ideas, fantasies and images inherent in sex role expectations for men and women in our society. The effects of stereotyping in relationship between the sexes and in individual lives raise provocative questions for discussions. Although ostensibly challenging traditional stereotypes, the program promotes more than a few itself, eg exclusive WASP cast in the dramatised segments; no reference to homosexuality, etc. Animation: M. Borczynski.
